moves.1. e4: This is almost always my first opening move.
moves.2. d4 d6: This is a mistake as it hems in black's DSB.
moves.3. c4 Bd7 4. Nc3 c6: What is the deal with all these little pawn moves?
moves.5. f4 Na6 6. Nf3: I didn't fear Nb4 because of Qb3.
moves.8... Bf6 9. e5: I jump on my opportunity to expand.
moves.16... b6: Wow, he is asking for it!
moves.19. Nh4: To prevent Nf5 which trades off my active bishop.
moves.24. a4 c5 25. b5: Can't afford to open the B-file.
moves.26... Rd7: I don't know how doubling is going to help him.
moves.27... h6 28. g4 Rh7: Is he planning to open the seventh rank?
moves.30. fxe6 Rdg7 31. exf6: I rip the game open and suddenly his King is a bit exposed...
moves.31... Rgb7 32. f7+:
He resigned. 
Taking it would leave him too far down in material, and Kd8 is answered by F8=R Mate!
Thanks for looking!
